<@U01429FHYA2> Does it is possible native HubSpot code, or can you share the idea how it is done?
That's off is said validation error however there is no other error message associated. I e not seen that before
Are all those properties the internal name?
I'd make the same call with a random email address and see if I receive the same thing

The properties I sent are of type:
```"email": string of a valid email address
"marketplace_id": uuid as string ,
"lastname": string,
"jobtitle": string,
"phone": string (which is often empty string)```
You should remove all empty values when you update. That might be an issue
I generally Google stack overflow es6 function remove empty values or something to that effect when I don't have my one liner function around
I also got the error with no empty phone field, and then all fields I sent not empty :confused:

Hi guys!

Here's the situation - I need to get a list of all companies filtered by one of the properties (type= PARTNER) through the API. what endpoint should I use?
Companies search. You’ll need to create a filter where the value is partner, “EQ  and the property is type
And if you create a contact with a different email, same thing?
What could be the mistake?
query should be “”
It works! Thank u!
Yes
It happened more than 10 times, with a different email each time

might want to change your sorts as well, you could like last updated or created, and do ascending or descending.

Remember to understand what those items do and when you are on the documentation page and trying to set up your call, go ahead and fill all the information in — it will really help you get a better grasp on these items. Typing these out and going the whole process will be the repetition you need to remember this stuff in the future

Thank you!
another question: what to add to the query for the association of found companies with deals and contacts?
Lol this is insane. Umm what happens if you just create with email address and no other properties?
If you receive this error with only email I'd be amazed

The next steps depend on budget and reuseness of your code. 

Best way is to look up schemas or associations and get the association ids and what not, then get those associations based off of the object and the association of contact id
You could postman and gather those ids and what not and hard code it in.
Is there a document for API examples? For example, parameters for looking for specific contacts, what type of lookups (by email, by id, etc) and that type of thing?

Guys. Trying to fetch the api usage daily limit...
```curl --location --request GET '<https://api.hubapi.com/integrations/v1/limit/daily?hapikey=XXX&userId=YYY>'```
`hapikey` is my dev API key and `userId` my user ID..

When I run the request:
``` "status": "error",
    "message": "The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.",
    "correlationId": "41401eb3-885e-47bb-b00f-f5984a6ea393",
    "links": {
        "support": "<https://help.HubSpot.com/>",
        "forum": "<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>"
    },
    "category": "MISSING_SCOPES"
}```
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
Is anyone else having issues with the HubSpot API right now? We keep getting 404's for calls that we were using a few hours ago
Yes
I was just testing something and everything is 404'ing for me
I was just about to post the same. Mostly on the search endpoints.
Although HubSpot doesn't seem to be aware of it yet
Same thing for us
We did make a ticket for this
404 is not ideal as status code for such a problem... 500s would be better
How long has this been happening for you?
Seems to be working for me again actually
Has been happening to us starting right around 12:10pm Central
back up for us
Working for us now as well.
Apparently a couple of people have had problems <https://downdetector.com/status/HubSpot/>
Hey we're having the same issues
Looks like the company api is returning way less things too now
Any endpoints returning weirdly for anyone?
The companies endpoints seem to be returning far less data all of a sudden

Curious if anyone wants to dive into their process for scoping out and pricing API integrations where you are connecting to unknown systems. I feel like I always underscope the hell out of these and then hate myself when projects drag on for an additional 2-3 weeks and I’m just bleeding time and money
